content: socks for peter with kroy sock yarn introduction i made this recipe for making socks for my husband most of the time i use kroy socj yarn that is a very plump fingering weight yarn slocer to sport weight i was having trouble putting it in knit companion so published it to ravelry as an easy way to have access to my own recipe i didn t dream anyone else would download it as they have i am updating the pattern for those lovely people skills required/techniques used knit in the round your preferred method i use 5 dpn s ssk knit two together kitchener stitch lucy neatby method of casting on for double pointed needles old norwegian cast on yarn 2 balls of patons kroy sock yarn - 50 grams 150 metres each needles i set of 5 double pointed needles or sock needles of your choice i use 2 25 m or 2 5 m needles notions one 8 to 12 inch piece of scrap yarn to use as beginning of round marker i find this the best method when using dpns 1 stitch marker gauge 26 stitches in 4 inches size one size - a mans large size can be adjusted by going up or down multiples of 4 stitches finished measurements 10 inch circumference leg length and foot length are adjustable abbreviations k - knit k2tog -knit 2 together p2tog - purl 2 together ssk - slip slip knit slip one stitch knit wise slip a second stitch knitwise and then knit these tow stitches together through the back loop 2 x 2 rib knit 2 purl 2 around st st stocking stitch knit every round * * repeat the instructions between the * to end of round pattern notes construction overview these sock are knit from the cuff down an option of a slip_stitch heel or eye of partridge heel are included they are finished with a wedge toe and kitchener stitch tips for adjusting the size the socks can be made wider or narrower by adjusting the cast on number of stitches i would recommend multiples of 4 stitches if using a number not divisible by four you should use a 1 x 1 rib instead of a 2 x 2 rib with an even number of stitches the leg length can be lengtheed or whorted to your preference the foot should be knit to 2 inches shorter than length of foot note that socks should have negarive ease ie be slightly smaller than the size of the foot for a nice snug fit cuff using old norwegian cast on cast on 28 stitches on one dpn and 28 stitches on a second dpn join for working in the round being careful not to twist the stitches place your scrap yarn over the stitches between the 1st and 2nd needle this is your beginning of round marker i flip the marker between the needles about every 10 row start working 2 x 2 rib
